comment._content: I'm guessing this is the 1904 U.S. Presidential (D) candidate Alton B. Parker AKA Judge Parker.  The image above looks like it says Parker, not Parner (the "k" and "r" are difficult to read, but seem to be there).

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: It does look as though the name is "Parker."  Thanks for the tips!  We'll check into it.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: We'll go with Judge Alton B. Parker, a New Yorker and chairman of the Democratic Party Notification Committee in 1912. The nearby negatives are all from the 1910s, and Parker did speak at a political rally in Indianapolis in August 1912, so the association seems likely. Here's a Wikipedia photo of Parker with similar facial features en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alton_B._Parker (If this photo shows that 1912 speech, a serious grand stand crash injured many people. Parker spoke after panic subsided, according to the New York Times, query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9C0CE5DA123CE6...
